result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy A Scott

records.addlTxt:
1:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy A Scott in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Jeremy A Scott.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Hayes states they are resolved.  Court cites agreement per the plea questionaire is for an 18 month DPA.  Parties agree.  Court questions DE on the plea agreement.  DE pleads NC to counts 1 and 3.  Court accepts plea/finds DE guilty.  VIS rec/rev by all parties.  State makes statement on behalf of the DPA.  Atty Hayes makes statement on behalf of DE.  Court admonishes DE - accepts DPA for 18 months.

Ct 1:  NC - DPA for 18 months
Ct 2:  Dismissed/read-in
Ct 3:  NC - DPA for 18 months

1:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo and Intern, Dan Moon, in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy A Scott in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Jeremy A Scott.  Atty Hayes advises matter is expected to resolve; however, there is some upfront conditions. Atty Hayes stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea hearing on June 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:39 PM Defendant Jeremy A Scott in court with attorney Kathryn E Hayes.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hayes advises negotiations are still ongoing and is likely to resolve.  Requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  No objection from State.  Matter reset.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
AMENDED - No violent or abusive contact w/D.H.  DE must take any medications that he is prescribed for his mental health.
AMENDED - No violent or abusive contact w/D.H.  DE must take any medications that he is prescribed for his mental health.

03:18 PM Defendant Jeremy A Scott in court with attorney Kathryn E Hayes.  Emily Eklund appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Victim D.H. also appears in person.  Court states case and appearances.  Victim has filed petition for modification.  State is objecting to the request for bond modification and explains why but won't object to telephone contact only.  Court has victim testify from the witness stand.  Neither counsel has any questions.  Atty Hayes makes statement on behalf of the petition and granting the victim's request.  State has no argument.  Court modifies to:  AMENDED - No violent or abusive contact w/D.H.  DE must take any medications that he is prescribed for his mental health.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact of any kind with D.M.H. or her residence or her place of employment.  May return to any shared residence one time upon prior notice and with law enforcement to retrieve belongings if necessary.

Pre-trial conference on March 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Return date on April 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:44 PM Defendant Jeremy A Scott in court with attorney Allison A Markoski.  Defendant Jeremy A Scott in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeremy A Scott appeared by video means with Attorney.  DE does not qualify for PD appt.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint - address is correct.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised rights to an attorney, waives that right.  State agrees to signature bond w/conditions.  Atty Markoski responds.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $1,500.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact of any kind with D.M.H. or her residence or her place of employment.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.  Return date scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.  Back on the record at 2:55 pm.  Atty Markoski by phone and State by Gabe Arevalo in person.  Atty Markoski states DE and the victim shared a residence and he would like to be able to retrieve his belongings.  State doesn't object.  Court orders modification of bond conditions to:  No contact of any kind with D.M.H. or her residence or her place of employment.  May return to any shared residence one time upon prior notice and with law enforcement to retrieve belongings if necessary.
